intro: Paullinia nodosa, commonly known as the Brazilian pepper tree, is a tropical plant native to South America. It is a member of the Sapindaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant produces small, edible berries that are often consumed by wildlife. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its adaptability, it can become invasive in some areas outside its native range.
